Version: Suomi Käännös By Ezra Lindholm [fi]
Content: Ja [vesimassat] tuhosivat kaikki elävät olennot, jotka maan päällä olivat, niin ihmiset, kuin karjaeläimet, maanmatelijat, taivaan linnut, ja ne hävisivät maan päältä. Ainoastaan Noaḥ ja ne, jotka hänen kanssaan olivat arkissa säilyivät elossa.

Version: Pentateuch with Rashi's commentary by M. Rosenbaum and A.M. Silbermann
Content: ויעש נח AND NOAH DID — This refers to his coming to the Ark.

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: In that same day entered Noah, and Shem, and Cham, and Yapheth, the sons of Noah, and the wife of Noah, and the three wives of his sons with him, into the ark:

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: And Noah was the son of five hundred years, and Noah begat Shem, Cham, and Japhet.

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: And the Lord spake with Noah, saying:

Version: Modernized Tanakh - Based on JPS 1917, Edited by Adam Cohn
Content: And Noah was five hundred years old; and Noah begot Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

Version: Targum Jerusalem, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: And Noah began to be a righteous man, and he planted a vineyard.

Version: Suomi Käännös [fi]
Content: Mutta Noaḥ sai suosion Herran silmien edessä.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And God spoke unto Noah, and to his sons with him, saying:

Version: Suomi Käännös By Ezra Lindholm [fi]
Content: Ja tapahtui niin, että Noaḥin ollessa 601 vuotta, vuoden ensimmäisenä kuukautena, kuukauden ensimmäisenä päivänä, vesi oli kuivunut maan päältä. Niin Noaḥ poisti katon arkista, ja näki; katso, maan pinta oli kuivunut.

Version: Hakakhah.com
Content: Noah was in his generations a man righteous and wholehearted.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years; and he died.

Version: Modernized Tanakh - Based on JPS 1917, Edited by Adam Cohn
Content: And God spoke to Noah, saying:

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: But Noah, who was righteous, found favour before the Lord.

Version: Modernized Tanakh - Based on JPS 1917, Edited by Adam Cohn
Content: And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his youngest son had done to him.

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: two and two they entered unto Noah into the ark, male and female, as the Lord had instructed Noah.

Version: Modernized Tanakh - Based on JPS 1917, Edited by Adam Cohn
Content: And Noah, a man of the soil planted a vineyard.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

Version: Pentateuch with Rashi's commentary by M. Rosenbaum and A.M. Silbermann
Content: ומלכי צדק AND MELCHIZEDEK — A Midrashic explanation is that he is identical with Shem, son of Noah (Nedarim 32b).

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: There were ten generations from Adam to Noah, to demonstrate the great extent of [God's] patience, for each one of those generations provoked [God] continually until [God] brought the waters of the

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And Noah builded an altar unto the LORD; and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt-offerings on the altar.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: For Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married unto their father’s brothers’sons.

Ref: Ikar Tosafot Yom Tov on Pirkei Avot 5:2:2
Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: There were ten generations from Noah to Abraham: [This is] not similar to "from Adam to Noah," since Adam and Noah are included in [those] ten. But here, Noah is not included; but rather since it ended with Noah [in the first group], it went back and started [the second group] with him.

Version: Modernized Tanakh - Based on JPS 1917, Edited by Adam Cohn
Content: The same day Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah’s wife, and the three wives of his sons entered with them, into the ark;

Version: Suomi Käännös [fi]
Content: Ja Lamekh kutsui häntä nimeltä Noaḥ sanoen; ” Tämä antakoon levon meidän työstämme ja kättemme vaivoista, viljellessämme maata, jonka Herra on kironnut.” [hep. Noaḥ on samasta juuresta kuin Nuaḥ, lepo]

Version: Suomi Käännös By Ezra Lindholm [fi]
Content: Ja Noaḥ teki, niinkuin Jumala oli häntä käskenyt, niin hän teki.

Version: Pentateuch with Rashi's commentary by M. Rosenbaum and A.M. Silbermann
Content: באו אל נח THEY CAME TO NOAH — of their own accord (Genesis Rabbah 32).

Version: Suomi Käännös By Ezra Lindholm [fi]
Content: Niin kyyhkynen palasi hänen luoksensa illan suussa, ja katso sillä oli nokassaan oliivipuun lehti, silloin Noaḥ tiesi, että vedet olivat laskeneet maan päältä.

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Cham, and Japheth.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: there went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, male and female, as God commanded Noah.

Version: Modernized Tanakh - Based on JPS 1917, Edited by Adam Cohn
Content: These are the generations of Noah. Noah was in his generations a man righteous and wholehearted; Noah walked with God.

Version: Modernized Tanakh - Based on JPS 1917, Edited by Adam Cohn
Content: And Noah did everything that the LORD commanded him.

Version: Suomi Käännös By Ezra Lindholm [fi]
Content: Ja Noaḥ oli 600 vuotias, kun vedet valtasivat maan.

Version: Suomi Käännös By Ezra Lindholm [fi]
Content: Ja Noaḥ meni [sisälle] arkkiin, poikiensa, vaimonsa, sekä poikainsa vaimojen kanssa, vesimassojen tieltä.

Version: Modernized Tanakh - Based on JPS 1917, Edited by Adam Cohn
Content: And the LORD said to Noah: ‘You and all your house Come into the ark; because I have seen you as righteous before Me in this generation.

Content: Said of Noah who was not an Israelite.

Content: And Noah begot three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

Content: These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man, and perfect in his generations. R. Johanan said:

Content: There are seven mitzvot that were commanded to the Children of Noah:

Content: These are the genealogies of the race of Noah. Noah was a just man, complete in good works in his generation, (and) in the fear of the Lord walked Noah.

Content: After forty days, Noah opened the window of the ark he had made.
